title: How Your Travel Spending Could Affect Treasury Yields
sub_head: If banks see big growth in credit cards and other loans, it could point toward rising yields on longer-term bonds
body:
The Federal Reserve’s latest pronouncements haven’t yet made a big difference for some key Treasury yields. Some calculations taking place at banks may be a reason why not.
As businesses and consumers have reeled in borrowing—such as by rapidly paying down credit-card balances—banks have had to find other ways to put the flood of deposit cash they received over the course of the pandemic to work. Many analysts believe a lot of that money has ended up in the Treasury market, helping to suppress long-term yields.
